page.title: 07Housing Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Dalgety Bay was developed as a residential satelite for approximately 10000 people to ease the pressure of the expansion of Edinburgh.The Moray Estates Developement Company sold land to Housing Developers who proposed to build low density quality private housing. The town was originally planned as an all private housing development. In the early 1970's, however, the Local Authority and Scottish Special Housing Association were approached to provide housing for workers in the Industrial Estate. Since the initial proposals many more firms have built within Dalgety Bay providing a variety of homes from large executive homes to small first time owners bungalows and flats. All the available land has since been built upon, the last phase of building being on the shoreline.
